3.1RC2

* started 3.1RC2 on my workspace for the first time and received this 
exception:

java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.osgi.internal.resolver.StateImpl.getBundles(StateImpl.java:138)
at org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.MinimalState.addBundle(MinimalState.java:97)

(PluginModelManager.java:444)

May be a PDE issue? The error message in the Error view is:

Error 2005-06-13 07:50:53.671 An internal error occurred during: "Initializing 
Java tooling".
Yes NPE is in PDE code.
Happens every time I start my workspace.

Workspace would not build successfully after this error. Had to create a new 
workspace.

It's easy to guard such an NPE.  However, it's best if we understand what 
workspace plugin could be causing this.  does your workspace contain linked 
projects that no longer to link to anything?

The plug-in causing the failure does not have linked content. It is an example 
plug-in on a private server.

Checking the project out into a new workspace does not cause the problem. 
Refreshing in the old workspace does not fix the problem either.

I understand.  Could you please attach the project's manifest.mf and/or 
plugin.xml please?  I don't need to have the whole thing.

Created an attachment (id=22943)
plugin xml file  - does not have a manifest.mf

Created an attachment (id=22992)
Patch

Was not able to reproduce.  However, an NPE during our plugin initialization is
detrimental, therefore, we should account for IPluginBase.getId() returning
null if a workspace plugin manifest was not read correctly or an id was not
specified.

Attached is a patch that cuts off such plugins at the source.

Konrad, +1?
+1 for the fix going into RC3.
*** Bug 100159 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
